title: Greenhouse Production Assistant
description:
THE ROLE


Gotham Greens is seeking passionate, driven and hardworking individuals to fill positions as Production Assistants. Production Assistant positions are hands-on and require individuals who enjoy rolling up their sleeves and are accustomed to manual labor-intensive jobs. This is an opportunity for an enthusiastic, self-motivated and organized individual to assume a position at a rapidly growing, innovative, disruptive company in the 21st century food system.


AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITY

* Packing Containers of Fresh Produce
	+ Sorting and selecting high quality product to pack
	+ Identifying unacceptable quality product to discard
	+ Filling containers to an accurate weight using scales
	+ Properly handling product and containers to maximize shelf life and appearance to the companys visual expectations
	+ Performing repetitive tasks at a consistent pace which meets productivity expectations
* Production Support
	+ Assisting Greenhouse Production operations, including transplanting seedlings, harvesting plants, and handling growing equipment
	+ Handling, organizing, and loading production supplies and equipment
	+ Assisting with inventory control and cold storage organization
	+ Labelling, boxing, and staging product materials and supplies
	+ Other duties as assigned
* Food Safety and Sanitation
	+ Follow Good Manufacturing Practices (GMPs), Good Agricultural Practices (GAPs), company food safety policies, and sanitation standard operating procedures (SSOPs).
	+ Assist with daily cleaning of production areas, equipment, and supplies
	+ Assist with periodic cleaning of common areas in facility


QUALIFICATIONS


Requirements:

* Be authorized to work in the US
* Lift 50 pounds
* Stand for a full 8-hour shift
* Maintain a steady pace with attention to detail
* Must have a reliable form of transportation
* Open availability to work various work schedules including holidays and weekends
* Must be able to work in varying temperatures that are anywhere from 55 degrees (within the Packhouse) to 90 degrees (within the Greenhouse).


WHO WE ARE


Gotham Greens is on a mission to transform how and where fresh produce is grown. We are a pioneer in urban indoor agriculture and a leading fresh produce and food company. Through our national network of local high-tech farms, Gotham Greens delivers fresh, long-lasting, and delicious leafy greens, herbs, salad dressings and pesto dip all year round to retail, restaurant, and foodservice customers.


Today, Gotham Greens has 9 locations with 600,000+ sq. ft. of hydroponic greenhouses across six U.S. states and over 350 team members. Since its launch in 2011, Gotham Greens has grown from a single urban rooftop greenhouse in Brooklyn, N.Y., to a multi-state greenhouse operator and one of the largest hydroponic leafy green producers in North America.


Gotham Greens recently raised $87 million in new equity and debt capital, bringing our total financing to $130 million and fueling our companys next phase of growth.
company_description: We're on a mission to transform how and where fresh produce is grown.

title: Nurse Practitioner
description:
**ABOUT US**


IVX Health is a national provider of infusion and injection therapy for those with Rheumatoid Arthritis, Crohn's Disease, Multiple Sclerosis and other complex chronic conditions. IVX offers a different, better approach to caring for our patients and believes it is vital to take the same approach with our employees. We strive to empower our team to succeed while embodying our core values: Be Kind, Do What's Right, Never Settle, Make It Happen, and Enjoy the Ride.

**ABOUT THE ROLE**


At IVX Health, our Nurse Practitioners play a pivotal role in ensuring the delivery of exceptional, personalized care experiences for our patients. With their specialized expertise in infusion therapy and comprehensive understanding of our care model, they are integral to our approach to healthcare delivery. Beyond their clinical responsibilities, our NPs provide invaluable support and guidance to our clinical team, patients, and referring providers. They bring a personal touch to every interaction, fostering a sense of trust and confidence in our patients' treatment journeys

 **HOURS AND LOCATIONS**


This position is considered Full Time working approximately 40 hours per week, Monday - Friday 8 AM - 5 PM with rotating Saturdays. This position is supporting our Paramus Infusion Center and our Clifton Infusion Center and would need to be flexible to work out of both locations.

 **RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Provide onsite supervision for all patients
* Assess and document patient health status, including intake and SOAP note documentation
* Work collaboratively with a multi-disciplinary team to ensure the highest level of quality patient care
* Prepare and administer infusions or injections following prescribed protocols
* Administer medications and treatments, with proficiency in dosage calculations (e.g., mg/kg)
* Prepare and administer infusions or injections in accordance with prescribed protocols and organization guidelines
* Ensure patient care is documented in the Electronic Health Record
* Maintain a clean and disinfected environment after each patient use
* Assist in maintaining medical inventory and supplies
* Provide patient and family education on disease processes and treatment side effects
* Support audits, regulatory functions, and annual staff review processes
* Reviews and ensure the accuracy, completeness, and timeliness of charge capture for all patient encounters while on shift
* Communicate openly with referring/prescribing providers regarding patient care
* Collaborate closely with referring providers for prior authorizations and sharing clinical notes
* Occasionally support related services such as pre-registration and prior authorization
* Works at multiple facilities within a designated market or region as needed

**BENEFITS**


At IVX Health, we value our team members and strive to provide comprehensive benefits that support their overall wellbeing. At IVX Health, we're committed to supporting our employees in every aspect of their lives. Join us and take advantage of these benefits as part of our dedicated team! Here are some of the benefits we offer:

* **Comprehensive Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance**: Our plans include prescription drug coverage and telemedicine services, ensuring you have access to the care you need.
* **Flexible Savings Options**: Choose from Health Savings Account (HSA) and Health Reimbursement Arrangement (HRA) options to manage healthcare expenses efficiently.
* **Supplemental Health Protection Plans**: We offer additional options for Accident, Critical Illness, and Hospital Indemnity coverage to provide extra peace of mind.
* **Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account**: Take advantage of pre-tax dollars to cover eligible dependent care expenses.
* **Voluntary Short-Term and Long-Term Disability Coverage**: Safeguard your income with voluntary disability coverage options.
* **Fertility Healthcare and Family Building Benefits**: Through our partnership with Carrot, we offer resources and support for fertility healthcare and family building.
* **Life and AD&D Insurance**: Protect yourself and your loved ones with life insurance and accidental death and dismemberment coverage.
* **Free Counseling Services and Resources**: Access counseling services and resources for emotional, physical, and financial wellbeing at no cost to you.
* **Education Assistance**: We support your professional development through tuition reimbursement and certification support.
* **CEU Library**: Access our Continuing Education Unit library to stay up-to-date in your field and advance your career.
* **Charitable Giving Match and Volunteer PTO Program**: Give back to your community with our charitable giving match program and volunteer PTO.
* **Employee Referral Bonus Program**: Refer talented individuals to join our team and earn a bonus for your contribution.
* **401(k) Plan with Company Match**: Save for your future with our 401(k) plan, with a company match to help you reach your retirement goals.

 **Note**: Please be aware that the benefits described above may vary for Full Time, Part Time, and PRN employees. Please consult your HR representative for details on eligibility and coverage.

**REQUIRED COMPETENCIES AND SKILLS**

* Excellent IV skills (Infusion Therapy experience a plus!)
* Strong mathematical skills for medication dosage calculations
* Demonstrates a commitment to improving the quality of patient care
* Exceptional active listening skills
* Committed to providing high quality, evidence-based patient care
* Excellent analytical and critical thinking skills
* Ability to integrate clinical judgment skills into decision-making
* Strong leadership skills, self-confidence, and ability to remain calm in stressful situations
* Ability to communicate effectively, in verbal and written form, with patients, providers, and coworkers
* Ability to demonstrate workstyle flexibility and teamwork
* Sound understanding of all federal and state regulations including HIPAA and OSHA
* Experience and strong familiarity utilizing Electronic Health Records (EHR) systems
* Knowledge and proficiency with standard office software applications including Microsoft Office Suite

**REQUIRED CERTIFICATION, EDUCATION, LICENSURE, AND EXPERIENCE**

* Active and unrestricted Registered Nurse and Nurse Practitioner license
* Board certified by AANP or ANCC
* Succesful completion of Master's Degree or Doctorate in Nursing program
* BLS Provider certification, credentialed from the American Heart Association (AHA)
* PALS Provider certification, strongly preferred, credentialed from the American Heart Association (AHA)
* Experience in an infusion setting preferred

**EEO STATEMENT**


IVX Health is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. IVX Health wants to have the best available people in every job, and we make employment decisions on the basis of business needs, job requirements, individual qualifications, and merit. Equal employment opportunities are provided to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, national origin, military and veteran status, age, physical or mental disability, genetic characteristic, reproductive health decisions, family or parental status, or any other legally protected category in accordance with applicable federal, state, or local laws. IVX Health prohibits discrimination, harassment, or retaliation of any kind based on any of these characteristics. Equal employment opportunity will be extended to all persons in all aspects of the employer-employee relationship and all terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, training, promotion, discipline, compensation benefits, and separation of employment.

title: Aquatics Manager
description:
**Position Summary:**

Asphalt Green is looking to hire an experienced Aquatics Manager to spearhead a new business initiative situated at a partner location. This off-site role will run our programming at the River East Elementary School at 2351 1st Ave (East 120th Street) in New York City. This newly renovated pool is 6 lanes by 25 yards full of crystal clear water. We expect that the pool will quickly become a gem in the community. We are very excited to start this new partnership and need a natural leader to make it successful.


Programming will include a mixture of Asphalt Greens free swim instruction and water safety programs for students attending the school plus other New York City public school students local to the community. We will also make time available to general community members as AG works to provide life-changing aquatics initiatives through community outreach in East Harlem.


The Aquatics Manager will develop and maintain positive relationships with all stakeholders to maximize pool usage and program outcomes.


This position will require a strong leader who is able to delegate ensuring that pool operations, including the pool deck, run smoothly while creating an optimal and safe working environment. Successful candidates will be experienced professionals looking to make an impact in youth development and community outreach, with thorough knowledge of all things aquatics. A background in water safety is required for consideration for this role. The role reports to the Director of Citywide Aquatics Programs.


This is a full time, on-site role. No remote work. Early mornings and some weekends are a part of the job.

**Responsibilities**

**Management**

* Manage a team of approximately 20-25 employees, including lifeguards, swim instructors, swim coaches and program supervisors; provide leadership, training, and tools for successful daily operations, and career development.
* Manage the pool deck, communicating information on pool conditions, schedules, policies, changes, and classes as appropriate and necessary.
* Oversee the day-to-day operations of the facility, inspecting the pool and programs with regular walkthroughs and monitoring quality to ensure everything is above board. Regularly communicate with River East operations team to maintain proper DOH levels.
* Manage an administrative budget in collaboration with the Director of Citywide Aquatics Programs. Review and approve part-time payroll, track maintenance supplies and general program equipment expenses.
* Hire, schedule and evaluate program staff, evaluating and scheduling as appropriate.
* Strategize to increase staff engagement and working experience; provide constant points of feedback through an employees lifecycle

**Communication, scheduling, registration, and engagement**

* Work closely with the Community Programs department to schedule multiple schools and afterschool programs across different class/course options.
* Communicate closely with school liaisons, teacher chaperones, and/or parent coordinators to ensure proper registrations, active engagement, and overall program investment.
* Serve as brand ambassador when meeting with administration and parents; attend school functions (back to school nights, etc.), schedule meetings with school principals, etc.
* Oversee program registration and enrollment process; ensure all data collection procedures are followed and that other outcomes measurements are captured according to established procedures.

**Safety**

* Maintain all standards and documentation required by the Department of Health and American Red Cross. Maintain accurate records related to maintenance on the pools and related mechanicals.
* Work closely with school safety agents to effectively manage and control access to the pool.
* Train Asphalt Green staff on and ensure implementation of River Easts emergency action plan.
* Maintain a record of any safety related incidents or accidents including reporting.

* Minimum of 3 years of management experience with a focus on instructional aquatics and/or competitive swimming.
* Experience in aquatics program management, with responsibilities including training, administration, and budgets at a Y or community center level is preferred.
* Strong leadership, time management, and multitasking skills.
* Strong computer, written and verbal skills.
* Spanish fluency strongly preferred.

title: Youth Flag Football Field Manager
description:
**Are you looking for hours on Friday evenings?** Asphalt Green needs to hire a **FIELD MANAGER** to lead our **Flag Football** coaches in the development of lesson plans for sessions and games while handling player rotations, play-calling and keeping the team motivated!


Our program runs **outdoors** from **September - June** on **Friday evenings 5:45pm-9:15pm**. ***Rain or shine****.* We are located on the Upper East Side at 1750 York Avenue at East 91st St. The Field Manager will be expected to manage football programming approximately 5 hours/week, every week we have football. We are looking for a leader with a Positive Mental Attitude (PMA) helping the players navigate the wins and the losses along with the lessons of youth sports. NOTE: Players are ages 7-13.


**Responsibilities:**

* Ensure coaches play all kids equally (on both offense and defense) while working to improve their knowledge of the game and related techniques.
* Leading the preparation and take down of all field and player areas.
* Model top-tier energy and enthusiasm for the game of flag football.
* Troubleshoot any issues with parents, players, staff, and all assorted collateral contacts that spectate our fast-paced, high energy football environment.
* Communicate and process in-depth knowledge of rules and regulations involving referees, players, parents and all involved with the program and outcome of official league football games.
* Document any on-field incidents after programming has commenced.
* Manage the hourly clock and field assignments for staff and players.
* Maintain quality control of the highest order.


Experience playing organized football is a plus, but not totally necessary.


Passionate about sharing knowledge and skills with the playerswith a desire to LEAD.


Experience working with young children in a fast-paced environment.


Attention to detail with high energy, team-focused priorities with strong customer service and communication skills are all essential for success in this special role.

title: Watchmaker
description:
**Position Overview:**

The **Watchmaker** is responsible for providing in-store watch maintenance, service, and performing quality control checks on watches in a timely manner to satisfy the needs of our customers. This role requires formal training and experience performing full-service repairs on mechanical and automatic movements.

**Key Responsibilities:**

● Conduct quality control on same-day serviced watches and advice Service/Sales Professionals if additional servicing is required.  
● Perform quality repairs on all assigned client-owned merchandise, including complex quartz and mechanical watches.  
● Assist other Watchmakers in resolving challenging repairs.  
● Identify and requisition parts necessary for repairs.  
● Communicate status updates to administrative staff and report areas of concern to  
management.

best practices, such as Internal Audit, Human Resources, and Occupational Safety.  
Qualifications:  
● At least 5 years of work experience in watchmaking or relevant certifications.  
● Demonstrated ability to learn on the job.  
● Willingness to be hands-on and work collaboratively with the team.  
● A passion for watches and excellence in service.  
● Detail-oriented with a mechanical aptitude.

**Working Conditions:**

● The role demands excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot issues  
efficiently

title: Case Aide (Bilingual Preferred) - Home Energy Assistance Program (HEAP) and Weatherization (WRAP)
description:
Case Aide (Bilingual Preferred)


EAC Network, a not-for-profit social service agency that empowers, assists, and cares for over 65,000 people in need through 100 programs across Long Island and NYC, seeks a Bilingual Preferred Case Aide work full time for itsHome Energy Assistance Program (HEAP) and WRAP (Weatherization).


TheCase Aideis a non-exempt position paying per hour $20 at 35 hours per week. Monday-Friday 8:45AM-4:45PM. The office is located in Hempstead, NY and role reports to Program Director.

**Comprehensive benefits package includes:**


Medical


Dental


401K


Vision


Very generous Paid Time Off (PTO) & More.

**Primary Purpose of Job:**


The Case Aide is responsible for interviewing clients, assessing eligibility and processing applications for Nassau County residents seeking financial assistance with their energy costs through the Home Energy Assistance Program (HEAP) and WRAP (Weatherization).

**Principal Duties & Responsibilities:**

* Interview and assess the eligibility of prospective clients seeking financial assistance with their energy costs.
* Process client applications, complete required forms and perform data entry in accordance with the guidelines established by the Nassau County Department of Social Services.
* Interact with other agencies and heating and utility companies.
* Prepare and maintain appropriate records and departmental paperwork.
* Demonstrates knowledge of computer programs necessary to perform job responsibilities (i.e. Outlook, Microsoft Word, etc.).

**Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities Required:**

* High School Diploma or educational equivalent required, Bachelor's Degree preferred.
* Minimum of one year of relevant experience working with low-income households.
* Excellent interviewing, communication and organizational skills required.
* Must be detail-oriented.
* Must be proficient in computer applications or other automated systems such as spreadsheets, Microsoft Office applications, calendar, email and/or database software necessary to perform work assignments.
* **Bilingual (English/Spanish) BIG PLUS/HIGLY PREFERRED!!!**

title: COTA (Riverdale/ Yonkers/ BronX)
description:
Hudson In Home Physical Therapy provides outpatient physical and occupational therapy to older adults in their homes throughout New York City. **We are specifically looking to fill a position in the Riverdale/ Yonkers/ Bronx.** We are a Medicare part B in home practice, and we are looking for an experienced and passionate physical therapist to join our growing team! We are open to bringing on a new grad as well!! Our clinic focuses primarily on geriatrics, providing one on one care for our patients.

We offer competitive hourly rates, the flexibility to organize your own weekly schedule and the autonomy to create meaningful and customized hour-long treatment sessions.

Our ideal candidate should possess excellent interpersonal and time management skills in order to maximize patient outcomes.

This is a great opportunity for a physical therapist who is looking for a different model of treating, outside the clinic, a physical therapist already making home visits who would like to take on additional work, or a physical therapist who is looking for a high level of flexibility in their work schedule. Make your own hours and schedule! Excellent working environment, excellent compensation. No OASIS. **Responsibilities:**

· Evaluate and treat patients in their homes

· Provide creative and individualized treatment sessions

· Engage family and caregivers as needed, providing education/HEP/DME recommendations

· Thoroughly complete all documentation via WebPT

· Maintain frequent communication with your supervisor and patient representative

**Requirements:**

· Eligibility to work in the US

· Ability to document per Medicare guidelines

· Ability to document evaluations and treatment sessions in a timely manner

title: MENTAL HEALTH CLINICIAN A28
description:
Provides clinical mental health services to all age patients/families in the Institute for Family Health. The scope of practice includes but is not limited to diagnostic assessment, counseling, psychotherapy, brief treatment, behavior modification, crisis intervention and mental health consultation. The social worker will report to the Regional Director and/or Program Director and work collaboratively with members of the health care team throughout the organization, while utilizing independent judgment in delivering care and services. This position is a learned professional, requiring achievement of specific advanced educational training related to the duties detailed.

**REQUIREMENTS:**


Provide individual, family, and group counseling, crisis intervention and concrete services.


Work in close collaboration with physicians and other health care personnel in patient evaluation and treatment to further their understanding of significant social and emotional factors underlying patients health problems.


Prepares comprehensive bio-psychosocial evaluations, mental status exams, patient histories, treatment plans and reports.


Conduct short and long term therapy with appropriate treatment plans, goals, and objectives.


May supervise social work student interns.


Educates staff regarding psychosocial issues related to patient care.


Actively identify child welfare issues and coordinate with the Child Protective coordinator regarding appropriate reporting procedures.


Document all patient services in patients medical records, completes encounter forms for all patient visits.


Assure social service compliance with legal, regulatory and professional standards, including Article 28 and JCAHO (where applicable).


Participates in social service quality assurance program.


Participates in Social Service Department meetings and all required staff meetings.


Demonstrates the knowledge and skills necessary to provide care, based on physical, psychosocial, educational, safety, and related criteria, appropriate to the age of the patients served in assigned area.

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Licensure in New York State as an LMSW, LCSW, LMHC, LMFT or Psychologist
* Strong diagnostic and clinical skills
* Healthcare experience preferred
* Bi-lingual, Fluent Spanish preferred

**Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action:**


The Institute for Family Health is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. This job summary is intended to be brief and may not list all the duties and functions required, however, it does highlight the essential requirements. Nothing outlined in this job summary is to be construed as an express or implied contract of employment.

 **Please visit****www.Institute.org****for more information.**

title: Leasing Coordinator
description:
**Who we're looking for:**


We're looking to build the best teams possible with highly motivated and engaged employees. We have an exciting opportunity for a Leasing Coordinator to join The Douglaston Companies. If you are looking to work in a collaborative and supportive environment, but also be challenged in your role, we welcome you to apply!

**Essential duties and responsibilities:**

* Meet and greet potential clients.
* Answer multiple phone lines and direct phone calls.
* Respond to incoming email inquiries on a timely basis and schedule tours.
* Organize and document high volume leasing traffic.
* Assist with client services.
* Assist with collecting initial rent payments, and lease execution.
* Assist with negotiating lease renewals and execution.
* Assist rental agents when needed.
* Perform other duties as assigned by management.

**Qualifications, Skills, and Abilities:**

* 3-6 years ofoffice administration experience in real estate preferred
* Ability to manage administrative functions that include guiding new residents through the application and move-in process.
* Professional appearance and demeanor.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Excellent phone and e-mail etiquette.
* Strong attention to detail
* Knowledge and experience with Microsoft applications (Outlook, Excel and Word).


Diverse candidates are encouraged to apply! The Douglaston Companies is proud to be an inclusive Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse workforce and providing a work environment that is free from discrimination based on any legally protected status or protected characteristic, including, but not limited to an individuals sex, race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, age, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, genetic information, medical condition, disability, marital status, caregiver status, pregnancy, citizenship, military or veteran status.

**What else can you expect from The Douglaston Companies?**

* **Health:**We proudly offer a full suite of health benefits! Thats medical, dental, vision, FSA, HSA, and even pet insurance for your furry family, to name a few. We also provide Life Insurance employer paid (basic with option to purchase more), Enhanced Short-Term Disability and Long-Term Disability coverage!
* **Wealth:**great pay, 401(k) plan with a very generous employer match and vesting schedule because your retirement is just as important to us as it is to you!
* **Development:**virtual courses, tuition reimbursement, lunch and learns and wellness programs.
* **Balance:**paid time off, 9company holidays, hybrid work schedule with 4 days in the office and 1 remote (subject to your location and role). We offer a fun-fast paced culture thats a perfect mix of high performance.

**Salary Range:**

* $55,000 - 60,000 yr.

**Who we are:**


Douglaston Development, Levine Builders, and Clinton Management are a dynamic privately held group of companies with a unique owner-builder-manager advantage, known collectively as The Douglaston Companies.


The Douglaston Companies started with the founding of Levine Builders in 1979 with just two people. Standing by our core values of integrity and ethics for the past four decades the firm has grown to 200 employees. By providing general contracting and construction management services, Levine Builders has built, renovated and rehabilitated thousands of residential units and millions of square feet of commercial, hotel, office buildings, retail centers, religious, educational, and healthcare facilities.


With the later establishment of Douglaston Development as the driving engine of the organization, the two companies worked in unison to leverage each others expertise to develop and build most complex projects while also growing and thriving in challenging markets.


In 2002, Clinton Management was founded to manage the expanding portfolio of developments created by Douglaston Development and constructed by Levine Builders. Clinton Management oversees a broad portfolio of moderate-income housing, luxury apartments, commercial, and retail properties.


Each affiliate company works together to cohesively acquire property, develop it to its full potential, and manage it efficiently, assuring that each investment achieves and maintains maximum value and profitability while strengthening the community in which the assets are located.

title: Business Development
description:
Employment Horizons, a nonprofit organization, is seeking a Partnership Developer for 30 hours per week. Hours are flexible. In this role, you will research, develop, grow, and maintain business partnerships to benefit the adults with disabilities in our Fulfillment Center. You will also represent the organization at in-person and virtual events. This position is part-time and may require occasional night and weekend hours.
  

  

**Primary Responsibilities include:**

* Actively market Fulfillment services to the business community
* Research and connect with prospective customers by utilizing media, door-to-door development, and trade events
* Cold call prospective customers
* Participate in business association meetings and networking opportunities that will cultivate business opportunities
* Create thoughtful and well-designed presentations for prospects
* Present business services to individuals and groups
* Lead each potential project through the development phase with all parties

 **Salary:**Competitive hourly salary plus milestone bonus for achieving targeted gross sales goals  

**Benefits**: Flexible schedule, hybrid work environment, generous paid time off including 15 holidays, 18 vacation days, and 10 sick days.

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* Support for Employment Horizons' mission
* Experience working in sales for the manufacturing industry or other services to businesses
* Outstanding entrepreneurial and negotiating skills at closing deals
* Excited by the prospect of cold-calling
* Strong presentation and computer skills
* Ability to lead and manage projects independently
* Motivated to create new partnerships
* Excellent time management and conflict resolution skills
* Excellent organizational and multi-tasking skills
* Superior customer relations skills
* Excellent oral, written, and interpersonal communication skills
* A valid drivers license

 **Preferred Qualifications:**

* Experience in the nonprofit sector

title: Cleaner Supervisor
description:

The Cleaner Supervisor is responsible for maintaining a clean, safe environment at Picatinny Arsenal while ensuring that contractual obligations are met. Additional responsibilities include training, supervising and motivating clients to perform the required tasks at Picatinny. In this position, you will work from 6:30 AM to 3:00 PM, Monday through Friday.

**Benefits:** Paid time off, including 11 holidays, and employer-paid medical, dental, and vision coverage.

company: Grenville Baker Boys and Girls Club

title: SPORTS & FITNESS COORDINATOR
company: Grenville Baker Boys and Girls Club
description:
Looking for someone to facilitate and instruct a variety of physical fitness and sports activities at the Grenville Baker Boys & Girls Club
### **Description**


Facilitate and instruct a variety of physical fitness and sports activities utilizing your knowledge of sports including soccer, basketball, baseball, softball, volleyball, and gymnastics. The ability to convey good sportsmanship and instructional skills is required. Experience working with children grades 1-12 is highly desired.
The ideal candidate will have some college course work for a physical education degree, or coaching experience. Schedule will vary to include 20—24 hours per week. **Grenville Baker Boys & Girls Club** is in Locust Valley, on the north shore of Nassau County. Our newly renovated facility contains 2 gymnasiums, a dance studio, and athletic fields to serve 150-200 children a day with programs that provide opportunities to develop skills which support intellectual, psychological, emotional, social, and physical development and facilitate a successful transition from childhood through adolescence, and into adulthood.  

Part-Time: Monday – Friday 3pm – 7pm Sept 9, 2024 through June 27, 2025
(Saturday hours required during winter basketball season)
#### **Salary**


$18 - $20 per hour

title: Director of Maintenance
description:
*Massapequa Center Rehabilitation & Nursing* is committed to improving our patients' quality of life & autonomy through innovative rehabilitative services, and an exceptional level of client-centered care and attention. We are seeking a Director Of Maintenance to join our interdisciplinary team of skilled health care professionals at our skilled nursing facility in Amityville!

DUTIES:

* Responsible for the maintenance and repair of buildings and grounds to maintain proper care of the community in accordance with current federal, state, and local standards/regulations and company policies.
* Regular inspections of the facility, for safety, upkeep, appearance & equipment performance
* Supervise and assign maintenance staff responsibilities and schedules
* Schedule & ensure completion of all maintenance & repairs
* Provide oversight of maintenance/repairs & ensure contracted services are completed in a timely fashion
* Performs routine repairs of building including, but not limited to, plumbing, electrical and painting
* Maintains records of all repairs, preventative maintenance, warranties and inspections
* Coordinating department operations, budgets and monitoring expenditures
* Must be able to recruit, select, hire, evaluate, train, counsel, and supervise maintenance staff

* 5 years experience in HVAC, plumbing, electric, carpentry & general maintenance

title: Healthcare Litigation Associate
description:
The New York office of Norris McLaughlin, P.A., has an opening for a healthcare litigation associate. The candidates should have 4-6 years experience in healthcare/commercial litigation. The position provides the opportunity to work both independently and as part of our strongHealthcare team.


**Responsibilities:**

* Provide legal counsel to health-care focused clients on federal and state health care regulatory issues impacting transactions and day-to-day business operations
* Handle all aspects of healthcare litigation, including drafting pleadings/motions, preparation of discovery and attendance at court conferences
* Handle hospital privilege actions
* Conduct insurance company Examinations Under Oath
* Draft, review, and negotiate a wide range of agreements and documents related to health care transactions, including mergers, acquisitions, regulatory compliance and employment
* Maintain direct communication with firm attorneys and clients, providing updates and strategic recommendation
* Handle insurance audits and professional license board matters, including before the OPMC and OPD
* Prepare for and attend administrative agency hearings

**Qualifications:**

* Proven ability to manage multiple cases and deadlines effectively
* Exceptional analytical, organizational, and problem-solving abilities
* Superior academic credentials
* Exceptional research, writing, and communication skills
* Must be bar admitted in the state New York
* Must have New York State court experience


If working in a high quality of life firm sounds appealing, give this opportunity serious consideration.

title: Freelance News Director
description:
ABC News is seeking a Freelance/Daily Hire DGA News Director to direct our new weekend shows. The ideal candidate should be in good standing with the Directors Guild of America (DGA)

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Direct Live News Broadcasts:** Lead the control room team during live news broadcasts, ensuring the seamless execution of all technical and editorial elements.
* **Collaborate with Producers:** Work closely with producers to develop rundowns, anticipate potential challenges, and ensure that the vision for the broadcast is executed effectively.
* **Manage Control Room Operations:** Oversee all control room activities, including camera shots, graphics, audio, and timing, to ensure a smooth and professional broadcast.
* **Adapt to Breaking News:** Make quick decisions and adapt the broadcast as breaking news or other live events unfold, ensuring accurate and timely coverage.

**Qualifications:**

* **Experience:** Minimum of 5 years of experience in news directing, preferably within a major market or network environment.
* **Automation Knowledge:** Proven experience directing News broadcast within an automated environment (preferably Ross Overdrive)
* **Education:** Bachelor's degree in Journalism, Communications, or a related field is preferred.
* **Union Membership:** This is a DGA position and union membership is required
* **Flexibility:** Ability to work flexible hours on weekends and availability for breaking new.

**Additional Information:**

* This is a daily hire position, meaning employment is on a as needed basis by the company. The position does not include benefits, and employment is contingent on the availability of shifts.

Job Type: Freelance

Schedule:

* Evenings as needed
* Every weekend
* Extended hours
* Holidays

Experience:

* Directing: 3 years (Required)

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Preferred)

title: Registered Nurse
description:
Responsible for working with other healthcare professionals to help treat patients with various injuries, illnesses or disabilities. Monitors patients, administers medications, keeps records, consults with healthcare providers, educates patients and more.  

  

  

  

**Principal Accountabilities:**  

  

1. Maintains accurate, complete health care records and reports.
  

2. Administers medications to patients and monitors them for side effects and reactions.
  

3. Prescribes assistive medical devices and related treatments.
  

4. Monitors, reports, and records symptoms or changes in patient conditions.
  

5. Assesses, implements, plans, or evaluates patient nursing care plans by working with healthcare team members.
  

6. Records patient vital signs and medical information.
  

7. Performs other related duties as assigned.


  
Required:
  

1. Bachelor degree in Nursing or related field.
  

2. 3+ years of experience in Nursing or relevant area.
  

3. Current state licensure as a Registered Nurse and BLS certification required.
  

4. ACLS certification.
  

  

Preferred:
  

1. Masters degree in Nursing or related field.

title: Nursing Assistant, Full Time Nights Medical Surgical (4S) HMC
description:
Responsible for working alongside physicians and nurses and facilitating advanced primary and specialty nursing services. Provides patients with support through activities including, but not limited to bathing services, serving meals, transportation, administering medication, and positioning. Ensures patients and families have a positive experience by exhibiting alertness, collaboration, teamwork, and a positive attitude.  

  

  

  

**Principal Accountabilities:**  

  

  

1. Supports nursing personnel in providing direct patient care and assists patients with daily activities.
  

2. Serves and collects food trays and provides between-meal nourishment.
  

3. Changes bed linen, runs errands and prepares and sterilizes treatment trays and supplies.
  

4. Transports patients within the facility for consultations, treatments, tests, or examinations.
  

5. Measures and records patients' vital signs such as temperature or pulse and provides basic treatment.
  

6. Ensures a safe care environment for the patients and their families.
  

7. Performs continuous rounds and check-ins throughout the shift to ensure patient and family needs are met.
  

8. Performs other related duties as assigned.

* High School diploma or equivalent is required
* CNA Preferred
* BLS Required

* 1-2 years in acute care setting preferred

title: Rentals Manager
description:
**Brooklyn Academy of Music (BAM)**is a multi-disciplinary arts center located in Brooklyn, New York. For more than 150 years, BAM has been the home for adventurous artists, audiences, and ideasengaging both global and local communities. With world-renowned programming in theater, dance, music, opera, film, and much more, BAM showcases the work of emerging artists and innovative modern masters.


BAM is seeking a Rentals Manager! Reporting to the Director of Corporate Strategy, the ideal candidate will manage and support the sales, lead generation, procurement of third-party external rentals for BAM, utilizing its campus and event spaces, prospecting, research, and vetting process for leads/inquiries of rentals and bookings. Also, maintain and own Rentals Pipeline and Tracker.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Field incoming inquiries and ensure all necessary information is obtained from prospective clients; manage BAM Events inbox
* Maintain process-integrity in the evaluation and vetting of rental inquiries, including cross-referencing internal calendars, venue availability, staff capacity, and budget parameters
* Work with General Management (GM) to maintain accurate calendar/pipeline of rentals
* Act as primary contact and maintain client relationships throughout entire rental lifecycle
* Coordinate with GM to conduct walk-throughs, create event budgets, and negotiate with clients
* Continue to develop and enhance booking relationships with agencies (WME, AEG, LiveNation, etc.)
* Manage the rentals contract process in collaboration with GM
* Manage financials and forecasting to ensure rentals and bookings are accurately priced
* Oversee invoices, incoming payments, and expenses for Rentals
* Continue to develop and secure private screenings and premieres with Studios (Amazon, Hulu, Disney, Netflix, Starz, etc.)
* Manage and schedule calls with clients, communicating needs to internal teams (GM/Production), and following-up with clients in a timely manner
* Collaborate with Director on research and identify new opportunities to engage and attract new business
* Negotiate all contracts and minimums, maximize revenue opportunities on the calendar
* Develop strong relationships with internal BAM stakeholders across BAM, including General Management, Programming, Production, Security, Marketing, and Box Office
* Collaborate with Director on marketing campaign and initiatives
* Maintain organized and up-to-date files and documents
* Collaborate with Director on systems and data processes
* Bachelors degree, or equivalent work experience
* Minimum 5+ years Event Sales experience, preferably for a large venue (not restaurant)
* Knowledge of and proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and the Internet
* Excellent oral and written communication skills in various formats with a variety of personalities
* Excellent multitasking and project management skills
* In depth understanding of financials and forecasting to ensure private event sales bookings are accurately priced with appropriate sales & demand
* Experience managing budgets and working cross-functionally to deliver an exceptional experience for constituents
* Demonstrate ability to effectively manage external stakeholders

**Compensation:** The salary for this position is $57,000 per year. This role is represented by Local 2110 and will be paid in accordance with the BAM/UAW Local 2110 Collective Bargaining Agreement. This position is full-time, non-exempt, and eligible for benefits. BAM provides a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, and vision insurance, retirement plan opportunities including both 401(k) and pension plans, as well as BAM-related benefits including access to BAM's fantastic programming.

**Working conditions:**Category 2: Administrative Work with Light Physical Exertion

* Must be willing and able to be on-site for walk throughs and day of event management
* Must be able to work evenings and weekends
* Hybrid Schedule

**Application Instructions:**Must complete an online application through BAM's website- no phone calls, emails or walk-ins, please.


Internal Applicants must apply through BAM's website.


Employees must meet all of the following criteria to be considered for an interview:


Completed at least 1 year of continuous, active service in current position. (Positions excluded include, but are not limited to, temporary assignments, and probationary employees):

* Meet the experience and skills requirements as outlined in the job post;
* Be employed in the current position for at least one year:
* Performed in a satisfactory manner without any corrective actions in the last 12 months

**Brooklyn Academy of Music is an Equal Opportunity Employer.**BAM recognizes that historic institutional practices lead to a non-inclusive environment and is working to address diversity and inclusion in all forms. Individuals in BAM are experiencing their own pace during this process, which is not uncommon when addressing power and privilege. The Advancement division supports and continues to take part in this process.

title: Nurse Practitioner, Heart Success
description:
The Nurse Practitioner will join an established multidisciplinary team and assume clinical duties in all aspects of heart failure, mechanical circulatory support, and ventricular assist devices in both inpatient and outpatient clinical settings. The NP will be largely supported and offered heart transplant and VAD training. The ideal candidate will bring a positive and caring attitude, excellent communication skills, and clinical expertise.


  
**Qualifications**

* Graduated from an accredited Nurse Practitioner program
* Must be licensed or eligible for licensure in New Jersey
* ACLS and BLS certification required
* Minimum of 1-year advanced heart failure/VAD/heart transplant experience preferred
Strong work ethic and a team player who can work independently  
* 

**Benefits**

* Competitive salary
* Robust benefits with health, dental, Rx and vision plans
* 403b retirement plan with company match
* Comprehensive Malpractice Policy
* Non-Profit Health System – eligible for Federal Student Loan Forgiveness
* Generous PTO, annual sick days, and paid holidays
* CME allowance and reimbursement for CDS/DEA, licensing, and boards
* Tuition reimbursement for advanced degrees
* Outstanding growth & mentorship opportunities

title: Financial Systems Analyst (Remote)
description:
**Responsibilities**

* Provide ongoing enterprise-wide support to executive-level management, general staff, consultants, and ancillary personnel as needed and/or requested
* Serve as liaison between Finance team and IT in order to maintain and improve system stability and data accuracy
* Serve as liaison between Finance team and external vendors and partners as required
* Support business in its efforts to make the best possible data-driven decisions
* Provide data and technical or Excel-based solutions to the business and its resources
* Lead and/or contribute to the development and review of test procedures
* Assist and advise in the streamlining and automation of business processes in support of efforts to improve productivity and efficiency
* Creation of Microsoft SQL stored procedures, administration, and automation; potentially troubleshoot existing procedures and processes as required
* Administration of Syntellis’ Axiom Healthcare Suite
* Work collaboratively with business and technical teams to develop or improve reports in order to support the best data-driven, data-supported business decisions
* Based upon business requirements, administer, create, and modify:
	+ Syntellis’ Axiom Healthcare Suite reports
	+ Oracle FRS reports
	+ Oracle FCCS reports
* Maintenance of:
	+ Oracle EDM and FCCS
	+ Axiom Reporting and Budgeting modules
	+ Access and security within Syntellis’ Axiom Healthcare Suite
	+ Accurate statistical data as defined and determined by executive leadership
* Provide training services for applicable systems, applications, and processes on an as-needed basis
* Manage, support and contribute to Syntellis’ Axiom application upgrades, testing, and customization efforts and projects on an ongoing or periodic basis
* Continuously work in concert with the Finance team to assist with achieving its goals and meeting its deadlines
* Coordinate and work collaboratively with vendors as well as consulting resources
* Review, assess, document and provide feedback on scopes of work submitted by vendors

  
**Education/Experience**

* Education: High School Degree Required. Bachelor’s Degree or technical training highly preferred.
* Experience: 2-5 Years preferred.
* Relevant Oracle University training preferred
* Strong, working knowledge of:
	+ Oracle Enterprise Data Management (EDM)
	+ Oracle Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP)
	+ Oracle Financial Consolidation & Close Service (FCCS)
	+ Syntellis’ Axiom Healthcare Software Suite
* Advanced knowledge of and proficiency with Microsoft Excel.
* Ability to problem-solve with strong attention to detail.
* Ability to create and develop written procedures.
* Ability to effectively work independently.
* Demonstrable understanding of data extract and data transformation concepts.

title: Pharmacy Technician II (Retail)
description:
Job Function 1 - Verifying information on prescription is accurate, interpreting medication orders and ensuring it has been completed correctly, Input patient and prescription data into the pharmacy program (new prescriptions and refill requests) \\*\\*computer skills required
  

Job Function 2 - Collaborating with the pharmacist on drugs that need to be reviewed (drug-drug, drug-allergy interactions)
  

Job Function 3 - Processing prescriptions through the insurance plan and resolving claim issues, Contact patients when medications are not available (back order or out of stock) etc
  

Job Function 4 - Requisitioning incoming purchased orders, Stocking pharmacy equipment required for prescription processing, Remove expired medications off the shelf, ordering medications through the wholesaler and restocking high volume medications
  

Job Function 5 - Contacting patients on medications requiring prior authorizations
  

Job Function 6 - Answer high-volume phone calls from prescriber offices and patients
  

Job Function 7 - Organize prescriptions for transport to the medical centers
  

Job Function 8 - Retrieve the correct medication for counting, pouring, weighing and measuring as detailed on the prescription
  

Job Function 9 - Appropriately package the medication, prepare prescription labels and information about the prescribed medication for the patient to ready
  

Job Function 10 - Teamwork. Supports the departmental goals as a team player by assisting staff members and being flexible in roles and responsibilities. Complies with departmental coverage guidelines. Actively supports the Atlantic Health strategic goals. Supports cross campus communications and sharing of best practices.
  

Other Tasks Which May be Required: Typing, familiar with Word and Excel are preferred. Able to work with new equipment/technology/computer systems. Makes recommendations for system improvements. Physical Requirements: As per Occupational Safety.
  
Required and/or Education/Experience: (Qualifications)


High School diploma or equivalent Required.


College courses desirable but not required.


Current active registration with the State of New Jersey Board of Pharmacy required.


Current Pharmacy Technician Certification Board (PTCB) or acquire within 6 months from start date.


Previous retail pharmacy experience (2+ years) preferred.

title: Broadcast Operations Manager
description:
**WORK OPTION:** Hybrid

  

The National Basketball Association (NBA) is a global sports and media organization with the mission to inspire and connect people everywhere through the power of basketball. Built around five professional sports leagues: the NBA, WNBA, NBA G League, NBA 2K League and Basketball Africa League, the NBA has established a major international presence with games and programming available in 214 countries and territories in 60 languages, and merchandise for sale in more than 200 countries and territories on all seven continents. NBA rosters at the start of the 2023-24 season featured a record 125 international players from 40 countries and territories. NBA Digital’s assets include NBA TV, NBA.com, the NBA App and NBA League Pass. The NBA has created one of the largest social media communities in the world, with more than 2.3 billion likes and followers globally across all leagues, team and player platforms. NBA Cares, the NBA’s global social responsibility platform, partners with renowned community-based organizations around the world to address important social issues in the areas of education, inclusion, youth and family development, and health and wellness.

 **Group Summary:**  

At the NBA, we’re passionate about growing and celebrating the game of basketball. Through the intensity of the game and the amazing athletic skill of our players, we deliver excitement to hundreds of millions of fans around the world.

  

As a global sports and media business, the NBA is so much more. While Basketball Operations runs the league’s on-court activities, other departments maintain relationships with television and digital media partners, develop marketing partnerships with some of the world’s most recognizable companies, oversee the licensing of NBA merchandise, and handle a wide range of responsibilities that drive the NBA’s success.

  

Off the court, we’re also deeply committed to social responsibility. NBA Cares leads the league’s involvement in addressing meaningful social issues by working with internationally recognized youth-serving organizations that support education, youth and family development, and health-related causes.

 **Essential Functions and Job / Position Summary:**

* Help to manage the broadcast operations required in the execution of the day-to-day acquisition, production and delivery of live game & event broadcasts
* Work with the various departments at the NBA in the support of broadcast initiatives including Broadcast Engineering, Production, Broadcasting, Basketball Operations, and Events
* Work in conjunction with the Broadcast Operations team on the planning, scheduling, logistics, and coordination needed to ensure flawless, and seamless productions & broadcasts
* Success in this role demands meticulous attention to detail, as well as the ability to interact with a wide range of internal and external stakeholders in a clear and concise manner
* The ideal candidate will be highly organized to ensure that departmental procedures and workflows operate as efficiently as possible
* Candidate must also understand signal flow and escalation & notification processes
* This position requires a work schedule coinciding with live game & event broadcasts to provide real-time support.
* Candidate must have a proactive approach, be one who is also able to handle changes as they occur, and address as necessary.
* Occasional travel to support remote broadcast operations

 **Major Responsibilities:**

* Support the scheduling, logistics, coordination, and communication of supporting live game & events
* Assist in managing the day-to-day operational needs of each production. Coordinate support with vendors providing master control, production, crewing, rentals and transmission services.
* Responsible for the reporting and escalation of outages, to senior / executive leadership
* Support the usage of High Speed Arena Network (HSAN) including Back Haul Services & Point-to-Point requests
* Work with Broadcast Engineering to streamline workflows and create operational efficiencies
* Work constructively and respectfully with fellow team members to achieve a common goal, while always upholding the values of the NBA

 **Required Education / Professional Experience:**  

**Educational Background Required:**

* Bachelor’s Degree in Communications, Broadcasting, Technology or other related studies
* In lieu of a college degree, significant field experience may be considered

**Experience Needed:**

* 5+ years experience in Broadcast Operations, Production, or related fields

 **Required Skills / Knowledge Attributes:**

* Knowledge of all facets of broadcast operations, including crewing, scheduling, signal flow, and production requirements
* Understanding of broadcast transmission standards, technologies, and best practices
* Strong strategic and analytical skills
* Ability to effectively communicate
* Experience in planning, implementing and independently leading multiple projects
* Experience with managing live game remote operations, preferably with a regional sports network
* Ability to multi-task, while working individually, and in a team environment
* Excellent verbal and written communications abilities
* Understanding of operational budgets
* Must be self-motivated, organized, with the ability to communicate clearly and concisely

 **Salary Range:** [[$105,000 - $125,000]]

**Job Posting Title:** [[Manager]]


The NBA does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firms or any other third parties. Any unsolicited resume sent to the NBA will be considered NBA property, and the NBA will not pay a fee should it hire the subject of any unsolicited resume.


The NBA considers applicants for all positions on the basis of merit, qualifications, and business needs, and without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, alienage or citizenship status, ancestry, marital status, genetic predisposition or carrier status, veteran status, familial status, status as a victim of domestic violence, or any other status or characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

**About the NBA**  

The National Basketball Association (NBA) is a global sports and media organization with the mission to inspire and connect people everywhere through the power of basketball. Built around five professional sports leagues: the NBA, WNBA, NBA G League, NBA 2K League and Basketball Africa League, the NBA has established a major international presence with games and programming available in 215 countries and territories in more than 50 languages, and merchandise for sale in more than 200 countries and territories on all seven continents. NBA rosters at the start of the 2021-22 season featured a record 121 international players from 40 countries. NBA Digital’s assets include NBA TV, NBA.com, the NBA App and NBA League Pass. The NBA has created one of the largest social media communities in the world, with 2.1 billion likes and followers globally across all league, team, and player platforms. Through NBA Cares, the league addresses important social issues by working with internationally recognized youth-serving organizations that support education, youth and family development, and health-related causes.

* Works with various internal departments to manage database of available content and oversee content updates as necessary

* Proven experience as a content manager

description:

This includes budget creation, analysis and management as well as working directly with the Legal department on contracting of new and existing vendors. The role will require frequent communication streams across internal groups as well as external partners/clients with a goal of finding efficiencies in all areas.

 **Major Responsibilities:**

* Lead and manage the execution and budget creation/tracking/analysis of multiple initiatives. This will include the opening and closing of projects, processing invoices, managing resources, and creating project tracking documents.
* Implement processes to properly support the Operational and Technical teams. Liaise directly with team leads to develop a system that provides information and streamlines communication.
* Establish and execute a cross-departmental system to consolidate information and messaging.
* Create a workflow cadence with Finance, and the group’s primary analyst, to stay aligned on monthly, quarterly, and yearly goals.
* Work closely with internal department leads on the tracking of their staff and sub-budgets that will roll up to NGT.
* Engage with key stakeholders and Legal to ensure that agreements, contracts, and releases are fully executed.

 **Required Skills/Knowledge:**

* Advanced knowledge of Finance, budgeting and estimate creation
* Understanding of Live Sports Television including Local and Studio Programming
* Strong presentation and communication skills
* Knowledge of the NBA, its teams and its affiliate leagues
* Detail-oriented and an ability to multi-task in a fast-moving environment

 **Experience Needed:**

* 6-8 years of relevant experience

 **Educational Background Required:**

* Bachelors degree required

 **Essential Functions and Job/Position Summary:**


The NBA is seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Broadcast Production Engineer to join our dynamic team. The successful candidate will be responsible for the technical planning, setup, operation, and maintenance of broadcast production equipment and systems. The Broadcast Production Engineer will ensure high-quality audio and visual production standards, assisting in delivering exceptional content for our audiences.

 **Major Responsibilities:**

* Operate and maintain broadcasting equipment & systems, including cameras, microphones, switchers, audio mixers, and playback systems during live and recorded productions
* Build and maintain working relationships with vendors for product support (rentals, upgrades, new product development, etc.).
* Maintain Video and Audio quality to uphold broadcast standards.
* Assist with supervision, facility design, construction, and installations as necessary.
* Perform routine maintenance tasks and system upgrades to optimize broadcast performance.
* Develop integration between scheduling, traffic, and automation systems.
* Collaborate with the production team to design and implement technical solutions for various broadcasting projects
* Assist in the design and installation of new production systems, ensuring compliance with industry standards
* Work with Broadcast Operations & Production to understand technical requirements and contribute to production planning
* Occasionally provide technical support during remote productions and live events

 **Required Education/Professional Experience:**

* 6 - 10 years of technical engineering experience.
* College degree in Communications/Engineering or related field required.
* Significant field experience will be considered in place of a college degree.

 **Required Skills/Knowledge Attributes:**

* Expertise working with routing platforms for video, media workflow and video production.
* Strong understanding of video, audio, and data signal flows, transmission standards, compression standards, and troubleshooting techniques
* Proficiency in operating broadcast equipment, including video/audio mixers, cameras, and editing software.
* Document technical specifications, workflows, maintenance procedures, and training material for equipment and systems.
* Strong understanding of Device Control Protocols, API, SNMP, and automating workflows
* Willingness to travel and accept shift and weekend assignments.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with diverse teams.

 **Salary Range:** [[$150,000 - $170,000]]

The role will work with a team of game operators on a nightly basis to supply a commercial-free game broadcast for the NBA App, NBA League Pass, and to 150+ international partners.


The ideal candidate will have a strong knowledge of the NBA and its content and will have experience both as game operator, and in supervising a team of game operators. * Must be available to work nights and weekends
* Manage daily GDC operations team to ensure daily delivery of required formats and rundowns to operators and vendor

 **Required Experience and Knowledge:**

* Minimum 3 years prior work experience in oversight of nightly operations of game stream conditioning as both an operator and a supervisor
* Knowledge of NBA and content offerings
* Excellent communication, writing, organization and interpersonal skills
* Ability to work independently and follow process with great detail and accuracy

* Bachelor's degree required

The primary role of this position is to support media management requirements for team local productions. This includes scheduling, tracking, media management, transcoding, and distribution of content. They will be responsible for supporting the day-to-day media requirements, including distribution of content (features, highlights, promos, etc.) to the local production team and acquisition/archiving of any content that is captured or created in the trucks, including digital melts, interviews, features, etc. This person will also be involved in design, development, and maintenance of workflows for content management and delivery.

 **Major Responsibilities:**

* Develop new and efficient operational workflows to support local productions
* Oversee staff supporting media acquisition, transcoding and distribution for all raw and finished content coming in and being distributed out of the facility specifically for local production.
* Facilitating the delivery of game broadcasts for cue sheet creation and music usage reporting.
* Work closely with Broadcast Operations and Media Technology teams to develop new standard operating procedures and documentation for all workflows involving content acquisition, quality control, and archiving of content intended for local production.
* Leverage league content taxonomies to organize this content appropriately in our Asset Library.

 **Required Skills/Knowledge:**

* Mac OSX support, SAN appliance and file system support, Adobe Creative Cloud Applications Support
* Digital Video Encoding and Transcoding
* Specific experience using Telestream Vantage and other encoding and transcoding experience a plus
* Strong leadership and communication skills
* Excellent organizational and project management skills with the ability to multi-task.

 **Experience Needed:**

* Minimum of 5 years of experience in media management, content production, or other related fields.
* 3-5 years managerial experience
* 3-5 years related experience supporting Mac OSX, SAN Appliances and File Systems, Adobe Creative Cloud Applications Support
* Experience working with transcoding software

 **Educational Background Required:**

This position requires a person who has a strong knowledge of the live content life cycle from capture to distribution. The ideal candidate will be able to aggregate and analyze information in order present a recommendation and if needed execute the vision. The position will work across multiple internal and external stakeholders to generate solutions for local production and distribution. The ideal candidate must be able to translate technical specifications and needs between engineering, production and executive leadership that may not be familiar with production.

 **Major Responsibilities:**

* Serves as a key resource for local production and operations personnel to strategize on deployment of available resource and management
* Work with Broadcast Operations and Engineering on resource allocation to properly support team and league initiatives
* Create material and documentation for proposed production workflows
* Maintain relationships with strategic vendors that can aid and enhance local production efforts
* Coordinate meetings and serve as an intermediary between production, technical and senior leadership.
* Provide risk assessment and cost benefit analysis on proposed production plans and technical solutions
* Assist with negotiations or provide guidance for production services as needed

 **Required Education/Professional Experience:**

* 4 – 8 years of experience working as part of a live sports production crew in an above the line, below the line or support capacity

 **Required Skills/Knowledge Attributes:**

* Strong understanding of roles and responsibility in a live sports production (both remote and studio background preferred)
* Thorough knowledge and relationships with domestic broadcast vendors (i.e. mobile units, crewing, rental houses, etc.)
* Working knowledge of satellite/fiber/streaming protocols
* Strong understanding of end-to-end signal flow from capture to distribution for cable, over-the-air and direct-to-consumer workflows
* Superior communication, analytical, design, planning and management skills.
* Understanding of live sports production budgets
* Experience using project management tools such as JIRA and Confluence
* Quick learner and detail oriented: critical thinking, analytical and problem-solving skills
* Must be able to disseminate information both verbally and in writing to production, technical and executive leadership
* Upholds a professional appearance and demeanor that reflects the role’s status as an ambassador and liaison between a wide variety of entities across the NBA ecosystem
* Assist in budget creation

title: Cafe Barista
description:
**A****bout Chelsea Piers:**


At Chelsea Piers you will find colleagues who are passionate about what we do. Careers at Chelsea Piers offer unmatched facilities, excellent benefits, and proven career growth opportunities for people who are passionate about transforming the lives of our community through sports, fitness, and event experiences.


This is an opportunity to be a part of an ambitious, high-end fitness business. Our goal is to deliver consistently safe, positive and engaging member experiences. Chelsea Piers Fitness seeks an enthusiastic, motivated individual to work as part of our team.

**Responsibilities**

* Positively engaging with customers
* Clean and restock fridges with food and beverage products
* Accepting orders and payments through Toast POS system
* Change keg lines when necessary
* Primary responsibility for making and serving all smoothie and beverage orders
* Answering customers questions about menu choices; promoting and recommending menu options
* Maintaining inventory and equipment by cleaning and troubleshooting
* Keeping the work environment sanitary and organized
* Evaluating and modifying processes to improve efficiency and quality of service
* Ability to craft and serve salads and sandwiches to customers when needed
* Cook menu items following SOPs, with the most consistent and high-quality standards.
* Prepare food for service (salad station, meats, sauces).
* Prepare coffee station for service.
* Prepare Grab n Go items (sandwiches, wraps) in packaging to be displayed in the fridge
* Take orders from customers directly or through Toast POS in a timely manner
* Engage positively with customers
* Clean and restock fridges with food and beverage products.
* Maintaining inventory and equipment by cleaning and troubleshooting.
* Keeping the work environment sanitary and organized.
* Evaluating and modifying processes to improve efficiency and quality of service.

**Qualifications**

* Provide a top-notch customer service to ensure you meet or exceed clients expectations.
* Excellent written and verbal skills.
* Excellent interpersonal skills.
* Training, motivation and retention of Canteen staff.
* Ability to lift 30 + pounds
* Continuous standing and walking throughout the work shift.
* Able to meet and perform the physical requirements and work effectively in an environment typical of this position.
* Food Handlers license

**Locations:**

* Brooklyn
	+ Prospect Heights
	+ Downtown Brooklyn
* Manhattan
	+ Chelsea
	+ Flatiron (opening soon)

**Compensation****: $18 per hour + Tips**

**Part-time and Full-time work available**

title: Part-time Nabisco Merchandiser - Marlboro, NJ
description:
**Part Time Nabisco Merchandiser**

Join our team of Part Time Nabisco Merchandiser and fulfill the merchandising needs of our customers through communication & relationship building, stocking store shelves, and maintaining or changing out displays. Become an ambassador of world-famous brands like **Oreo, Ritz, belVita, Chips Ahoy, Triscuit,** among other delicious industry-leading snacks.

* Represent Mondelēz in front of in-store employees and work closely with sales representative to optimize visibility of Mondelēz products on shelves and to construct promotional displays.
* Carry out in-store visits according to Mondelēz’ DSD Merchandising Steps.
* Ensure Nabisco leading brands (Oreo, Ritz, belVita, Chips Ahoy, Triscuit, among others) are well represented, stocked, and maintained through the implementation of Mondelēz’ guidelines.
* Ensure Sales Representative’s negotiated plans with store managers are being followed and communicate any issues with Mondelēz’ management team.
* Follow the daily schedule set by the merchandising manager to ensure the most efficient in-store service.
* Enhance seasonal sales, seasonal displays, and new product launches.
* Demonstrate positive, and upbeat attitude while representing Mondelēz in store.

For a closer view of what our merchandisers do: Day in the Life of a Mondelez Merchandiser

**What you can expect from us:**

* Hourly compensation rate of **$16/hr**. based on relative experience
* 401k Savings Plan (effective September 2024)
* Mileage reimbursement (according to company policy)
* Strong career advancement opportunities within the company
* Health and Well-Being Program
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
* Reimbursement of business internet/data expenses up to $10/per month if company device is not provided.
* Safety equipment such as kneeling pads, safety knives, and PPE

* Be at least 18 years of age, have a valid driver's license and proof of auto insurance.
* Someone with a positive and professional attitude who is self-motivated and can work independently.
* Ability to drive your personal vehicle to a variety of store locations (mileage will be reimbursed).
* Ability to perform hard work in a fast-paced work environment and to meet the defined physical activities like repetitive lifting, bending, and carrying up to 25 lbs. Occasionally, pushing and pulling over 50 lbs. This includes physically moving our products from the stock rooms to store floor and stocking the store’s shelves.
* Previous retail / grocery experience is a plus.
* Live within 25 miles range from the primary location **Marlboro, NJ**
* Secondary locations: **Old Bridge, East Brunswick, Freehold**

Join Ivy Rehab’s dedicated team where you’re not just an employee, but a valued teammate! title: Retail Floor Leader (Key Holder) - Mt. Olive
description:
Floor Leaders serve as product and operational experts, driving sales while ensuring an excellent customer experience. They act as product and brand ambassadors for Skechers.***Compensation & Benefits Information***

***Starting Rate: $17.48***

***Range is: $16.98 - $18.55***

* Generous employee discount for Skechers footwear, apparel & accessories
* Friends & Family Discount Events
* Employee Assistance Program
* Flexible Schedule
* Career Growth
* Fun Work Environment
* Community Focus

* Provide an exceptional customer service, greeting customers and advising them on Skechers’ products.
* Executes detailed stock and product management routines; merchandising, stocking, and cleaning – whatever it takes to create a premier shopping experience for the customer.
* Help train store employees on product knowledge and visual marketing standards.

Skechers (NYSE: SKX), a global, Fortune 500® brand develops and markets a diverse range of lifestyle and performance footwear, apparel, and accessories.
